Package zoot.tube.googleapi

Class GoogleAuthJava

  • java.lang.Object
    • zoot.tube.googleapi.GoogleAuthJava
  • public class GoogleAuthJava
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles the authentication of users through Google.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GoogleAuthJava

        public GoogleAuthJava​(java.lang.String clientSecretsUrl,
                      java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> scopes)
        Creates this using the client secrets JSON file location and scopes specified.

        The passed scopes will be copied into a new Collection to prevent changes after this is created.

        Parameters:
        clientSecretsUrl - the file location of the client secrets JSON file.
        scopes - the scopes the client is requesting.

    • Method Detail

      • authorizeAndGetNewCredential

        public com.google.api.client.auth.oauth2.Credential authorizeAndGetNewCredential​(java.lang.String userId)
        Creates a fresh Credential for a user.

        If there is an error while retrieving the Credential, an empty Credential will be returned.

        This call originates the auth request from this, and does not use a webserver. So the client secrets MUST NOT require a redirect Url. (The OAuth uses the "other" type).

        Parameters:
        userId - userId or null if not using a persisted credential store.
        Returns:
        a Credential.

      • authorizeUsingUserCode

        public com.google.api.client.auth.oauth2.Credential authorizeUsingUserCode​(java.lang.String code,
                                                                           java.lang.String redirectUri)
        Creates a Credential using a one-time UserCode.

        Note: Must be using a WebServer to use this method.

        Parameters:
        code - the user's code.
        redirectUri - an authorized redirectUri known by the Google OAuth Client.
        Returns:
        a Credential for the user the code belongs to.

      • authorizeUsingRefreshToken

        public com.google.api.client.auth.oauth2.Credential authorizeUsingRefreshToken​(java.lang.String refreshToken)
        Creates a Credential using a refresh-token.

        If the authorization fails using the given refresh-token, an empty Credential will be returned.

        Parameters:
        refreshToken - the refresh-token.
        Returns:
        a Credential.
